alert.note: Alert for Haskell; McIntosh; Muskogee; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued May 04 at 10:54PM CDT until May 04 at 11:15PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1115 PM CDT FOR WEST CENTRAL HASKELL...MCINTOSH...NORTHEASTERN PITTSBURG... SOUTHEASTERN OKMULGEE AND CENTRAL MUSKOGEE COUNTIES... At 1054 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm was located 4 miles west of Checotah, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. Locations in or near the path include... Okmulgee... Eufaula... Henryetta... Checotah... Morris... Dewar... Schulter... Oktaha... Grayson... Council Hill... Rentiesville... Hoffman... Stidham... Raiford... Vivian... Lake Eufaula State Park... Enterprise... Keefeton... Wainwright... Summit... This includes Interstate 40 in Oklahoma between mile markers 239 and 274. TORNADO...POSSIBLE HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for southeastern, northeastern and east central Oklahoma. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
